item.title: 4 reasons why you don’t get a new client Today
item.description: Each day – new companies want to make the world a better place and try to sell you fantastic service, API, whatever. I’m constantly searching for new exciting, and valuable services which could make “my” (my clients) live easier. Everyone has a flashy website, “Try now”, “Try now for free”, “Signup for free” – fill the form, no credit card required… entry level – no trouble at all. Let’s do it.

item.title: How to choose the right technology for your next project
item.description: People quite often asking me about technology stack, and where to go with next big project. The answer isn’t simple – it depends. Usually, we have couple components which are critical for the whole system. If we are talking about a web-based solution or any API we have to decide about DATABASE, then we have STORAGE, moving on – some BACKEND service language.

item.title: Web Dev libraries – week 21
item.description: I’m consuming enormous amount of news each day. These is list of my findings from just only these week. Envision.js is a library for creating fast, dynamic and interactive HTML5 visualisations. Apy is a simple client-side library for making rest api ajax calls. Sitespeed.io is an open source tool that helps you analyse your website speed and performance based on performance best practices and metrics. It collects data from multiple pages on your website, analyze the pages using the rules and output the result as HTML or JUnit XML.

item.title: CodeIgniter-minify update
item.description: Just introduce some new options to my quite popular library CodeIgniter-minify . From now one you can chose CSS compression engine (cssmin || minify), also FORCE rewrite CSS files. Some speed improvements were also made. Please feel to checkout library on GitGub – CodeIgniter-minify

item.title: The easiest way to share files within same network
item.description: Sometimes you are just to lazy to copy files to local storage server. Sending files over email ? To long. What other options you have. If you are on Mac – AirDrop is an answer but – you have to be on wireless. What if you are using old fashion cable ? There is a solution for that – web experiment called www.sharedrop.io ShareDrop is a free app that allows you to easily and securely share files directly between devices in the same local network*, without having to upload them to any server first.

item.description: I’m huge fan fan ow AWS services. It just works – don’t need any kind of support, prices are really good. No issues whatsoever. Just to give a small background – got registered business since 2011 in Australia. I filled out my CC details, phone number and so on. Pretty standard process. I logged in, and start playing with their interface (pretty slow, but I shouldn’t complain yet). The best is about to come…

item.title: Cut and slice Photoshop files really easy
item.description: This is one if these rare plugins which make my live lot easier. Actually can’t imagine my work without it.  Cut&Slice me  is able to export your assets to different devices in seconds. Whole idea is really simple – name objects, or groups in special way. Click one button – and all assets will be exported in proper file names. It’s getting event better – his plugin is able to export all assets in multiple dimensions (retina images). So… if you ever dreamt about perfect tool for you work – this is it.

item.title: Gearman installation on CentOS and AMI Linux
item.description:
Gearman provides a generic application framework to farm out work to other machines or processes that are better suited to do the work.

This solution is truly multiplatform, so we have Client API and Wordkres in multiple languages like Shell, Perl, NodeJS any couple of others (PHP!)

item.title: Amazon AWS finally in Australia
item.description: Finally we can enjoy power and speed of Amazon AWS services, in Australia but… so far we can’t get full experience, it’s only for two services – Amazon Route 53 and Amazon CloudFront . So… in simple words we can enjoy with 100% SLA DNS service and global CDN with edge location based on Sydney.

item.title: Amazon RDS for $20 monthly
item.description: Amazon AWS just announced that Micro instances can be used for Amazon RDS with MySQL database engine which is really good news. Previously cheapest option  was Small Instance which was quite “expensive” with $0.105 USD for on hour (without reserved instances). Now we can use RDS with MySQL for $0.025 hourly! We can go even lower with reserved instances. Details about pricing are available here .

item.title: Web thumbnails for free
item.description: Taking snapshots of websites – it’s very simple thing, but … you need to install an browser extension – I’m using Awesome Screenshot , or use magic shortcut in Mac OS X. You can also take advantage of services specializing in this task, but as far as I know there are not many free solutions. So today I will describe the project webthumbnail.org .</ The idea is very simple – generate snapshots of the page at any resolution, we can choose between several browsers (Chrome, FireFox, Opera).

item.description: I was looking for some kind of easy to use Window Manager for Mac OS X. Usually I’m working on multiple screen with multiple application open (usually it’s between 4-8). item.title: Google Storage for Developers vs Amazon S3
item.description: I just got activation for Google Storage for Developers . Service is similar to Amazon S3 but it’s served by Google and it’s still in beta mode – that’s mean that you can’t just register and use, and you have limited warranty about quality and uptime.

item.title: CodeIgniter OpenSource Web Application Framework
item.description: For many years we was searching for for really good framework for our application core. After trying Zend Framework which is really power-full, but quite heavy for regular use, we tried to use some lighter – CakePHP which is better, but still many solutions are to complicated for real rapid development and freedom, we found what we are looking for – CodeIgniter .
